archimate:ArchimateDiagramModel.name: Business Strategy
archimate:ArchimateDiagramModel.documentation:
The Business Strategy outlines the organization’s long-term goals, objectives, and value propositions. It defines what the business wants to achieve and why.
Role in Architecture Vision:
• Drives the overall direction of the architecture. • Helps define scope, priorities, and constraints of the architecture work. • Ensures architecture aligns with business drivers and stakeholder needs.
Typical Inputs:
• Mission and vision statements • Business goals and KPIs • Strategic business initiatives • Market analysis or competitive positioning • Business capability requirements • High-level process models or business models (like Business Model Canvas)
Output Influence:
• Helps shape the Architecture Vision Document • Defines business scenarios • Informs the Statement of Architecture Work • Identifies stakeholders and their concerns
